job_description: Quant Developer - job post Qodoro LLC Qodoro LLC in New York, NY 10001 From $70 an hour -  Contract Responded to 51-74% of applications in the past 30 days, typically within 11 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary From $70 an hour Job Type Contract Job Title: Developer Mastery (Quant Risk Developer) Duration: 6+ months (Contract to Hire) Location: NYC, New York OR Boston, MA Job Type: Hybrid (need to be Onsite 1-2 times every 1-2 weeks) Description: As a quantitative risk Analyst, you will be involved with quantitative model implementation, development, and analysis. The ideal candidate will work with a quant team (Developers and Analysts) to enhance ERM's analytical and reporting capabilities, by designing and developing new tools and risk frameworks. The Capital & Investment Risk Management team is responsible for the identification, measurement and analysis of MassMutual's portfolio, credit and capital risks. The team recommends risk management strategies and equips senior leadership with information they need to take advantage of opportunities and mitigate risks. Members of the team bring expertise and experience across a range of risk measurement and management disciplines, focused continuous improvement and development and business acumen. The Overall Responsibilities: Implement, develop, and enhance ERM's analytical capabilities related to credit/market risk across a wide range of fixed income asset classes Building on MassMutual's current approach, assist in developing and syndicating a comprehensive framework for measuring portfolio credit & market risk, that considers different accounting and capital regimes, including asset and liability impacts, with a particular emphasis on economic capital Build meaningful reports by asset class and comprehensive level, collaborating with the quant development and IT/engineering teams Use of Python/ SQL Use of spreadsheets and VBA to do prototyping and analyze data Data investigation/cleanup. Expand the use of Moody's credit risk tools in place at MassMutual today Strengthen ERM's use and development of tools and analytics to support derivatives counterparty risk & portfolio concentration risk Scope and implement modeling, including building out requirements where not yet fully defined or understood. Agile, accountable, and resilient in driving results Skills: Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience in investment (credit/market) quantitative risk analytics Moderate level skills in Python and SQL Quantitative model development & implementation skills and ability to validate analytical results Experience in quantitative risk modeling across a wide range of asset classes Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline Desire to use your quantitative and programming skills in a hands-on setting to deliver new functionality 5-7 or more years of relevant work experience is desirable Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, Financial Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, engineering, or similar quantitative discipline is preferred Knowledge and experience working with derivatives and hedging risk management Experience in using Moody's Analytics credit risk tools is desirable Experience in CECL compliant portfolio credit models Previous experience working on liability driven investing projects within an insurance company is desirable Experience applying machine learning techniques in the financial industry is desirable Job Type: Contract Salary: From $70.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Application Question(s): Are you comfortable working on W2? Experience: Quantitative analysis: 5 years (Preferred) Python: 5 years (Preferred) Corporate finance: 5 years (Preferred) SQL: 5 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Go Engineer - job post TrueFort Weehawken, NJ Full-time, Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Contract The Opportunity TrueFort is a hot cybersecurity startup in the cloud workload protection space, and we offer the chance to work with some of the most experienced engineers from Wall Street. Our platform is fully REST-API driven and uniquely focuses on security policy and protection from the application context with an open ecosystem approach. As a software engineer at TrueFort, you will be part of our product engineering team developing our platform’s backend services and processes. And as a full-time employee, your compensation will include a competitive salary, stock options, cool perks, and generous benefits. Who are you? A highly-motivated, experienced software engineer with strong technical, problem solving, and design skills. If you have a passion for new technologies and services and an ability to solve complicated problems with simple solutions, you’re the person we’re looking for. What will you do? You’ll work as part of an experienced engineering team within an Agile environment, responsible for your specific assignments, while contributing to a greater whole. Responsibilities Requirements Good To have Participate in full life-cycle software development Design, implement, and deploy highly scalable and reliable systems Contribute ideas for new features and proactively identify areas for improvement Mentor the team on best practices, patterns, and techniques Work closely with strategy, business and UX teams 4+ years of C++/Golang Programming experience in a Unix/Linux environment Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design concepts Proficiency with relational databases / SQL development Experience designing and implementing REST and XML-based web services Experience working on large-scale distributed systems, data-driven architecture and systems design Understanding of Agile SDLC methodology MS/PhD in Computer Science or related field Knowledge of the logistics, freight industry, and enterprise software integrations Experience with Docker and Kubernetes Experience re-architecting and/or re-implementing a legacy enterprise application Experience and/or senior-level technical knowledge of monitoring and analytics solutions Experience working with cloud service providers such as AWS and Azure
